prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
For API StringTokenizer.nextToken, the API usage rule is: Create a StringTokenizer with a specified string and delimiter, and then obtain the next token as long as there are more tokens available.

Question: Getting substring from String in java: :This question already has answers here:                                                            How do I split a string in Java?                                (38 answers)                            Closed 6 years ago.I have a string that contains data with different values, something like String values = "firstname=john&lastname=fob&email=something@something.com&Telephone=3874813781"FYI: & is the separator.I want to make a new string for all these parameters - firstname, lastname, email and etc... - and I want the string to contain only the value of it specific parameter something like String firstname = "john";and same for lastname and so on. I think it is not better to use String firstname = values.indexOf(10);because I don't know how many characters would the username contain so I could go for lastname an so, I was wondering if there is a better way for getting the values of each parameter and assign it to a new string.
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
String values = "firstname=john&lastname=fob&email=something@something.com&Telephone=3874813781";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(values, "&");
String firstname = "";
String lastname = "";
String email = "";
String telephone = "";

while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
    String token = st.nextToken();
    if (token.startsWith("firstname=")) {
        firstname = token.substring(token.indexOf("=") + 1);
    } else if (token.startsWith("lastname=")) {
        lastname = token.substring(token.indexOf("=") + 1);
    } else if (token.startsWith("email=")) {
        email = token.substring(token.indexOf("=") + 1);
    } else if (token.startsWith("Telephone=")) {
        telephone = token.substring(token.indexOf("=") + 1);
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: 
In this code, we first create a StringTokenizer object with the input string "values" and the delimiter "&". Then, we initialize empty strings for each parameter (firstname, lastname, email, and telephone). 

We use a while loop to iterate through each token in the StringTokenizer. For each token, we check if it starts with the parameter name followed by an equals sign. If it does, we extract the value of the parameter by using the substring method and assigning it to the corresponding string variable.

After the loop, the variables firstname, lastname, email, and telephone will contain the values extracted from the input string.
